contentrichtext.text: {{Unreferenced|date=January 2009}} {{In-universe|subject = Three Kingdoms|category = Three Kingdoms|date = October 2009}} {{Chinese |t=辛評 |s=辛评 |p=Xīn Píng }} {{chinese-name|[[Xin (surname)|Xin]]}} '''Xin Ping''' (died 204), [[Chinese style name|style name]] '''Zhongzhi''' (仲治), was a minister serving under the warlord [[Han Fu (warlord)|Han Fu]] during the late [[Han Dynasty]] period of [[History of China|Chinese history]]. Following the death of Han Fu, Xin went on to serve [[Yuan Shao]], acting as an adviser to [[Yuan Tan]], Yuan Shao's oldest son. Once, Xin was invited by [[Cao Cao]] to serve him when he met Cao as an envoy, but he declined. Xin Ping's younger brother, [[Xin Pi]], switched allegiance to Cao Cao after Yuan Shao's death and continued serving the state of [[Cao Wei]] during the [[Three Kingdoms]] period. ==See also== *[[List of people of the Three Kingdoms]] {{DEFAULTSORT:Xin, Ping}} [[Category:Officials under Yuan Shao]] [[Category:2nd-century births]] [[Category:204 deaths]] [[Category:Officials under Cao Cao]] {{China-bio-stub}}
